definition: to skate around/to skip over/to skimp
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)

sentences.english: Usually only does not treat seriously to the cultural context knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 通常只对文化背景知识一带而过。

sentences.english: The chairman slurred over the problem at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 会议主席在会上对这个问题一带而过。

sentences.english: He skated over the mistakes he made.
sentences.chinese: 他对他所犯的错误一带而过。

sentences.english: Every time we came to that delicate problem, the chairman skates over it.
sentences.chinese: 每次我们谈到这个微妙的问题时主席都一带而过。

sentences.english: And there was just 1 line, that I blazed past, probably too quickly.
sentences.chinese: 总共只有一行语句，我上次是一带而过了。

sentences.english: Specific those things that should learn later, just be taken in the book and pass.
sentences.chinese: 具体以后该学的那些东西，书中只是一带而过。

sentences.english: You can skate on this one , John.
sentences.chinese: 你可以巧妙地一带而过，约翰。

definition: to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to pass over/to skip
to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
to touch on sth and leave it there/to take care not to overdo sth
to speak in general terms
to rush through the work/to get through a thing carelessly
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
not to affect sb/irrelevant/of no importance/insignificant
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
to mention/to raise (a subject)/to bring to sb's attention
minor details/trifles
to omit/to delete/to leave out/to neglect/to skip over
to perform an in-depth investigation
(of a text) very lengthy (idiom)
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge/also written 淺嘗輒止|浅尝辄止
